subject: Relationships
title: The Friendship Recession
description: A fast breakdown of The Friendship Recession for builders.

hook.text: In 1990, 33% of Americans said they had 10+ close friends. In 2023, that number dropped to 13%.

buildup.text: Sociologists call it the 'friendship recession' â€” a decades-long decline in close social bonds across the West.

discovery.text: Contributing factors: longer work hours, suburban sprawl, social media replacing face-to-face interaction.

twist.text: Men are hit hardest. 15% of men report having no close friends at all â€” up from 3% in 1990.

climax.text: We're more connected than ever and lonelier than ever. Technology connected us online and isolated us offline.

punchline.text: We have more contacts and fewer friends than any generation before.

quiz.question: What percentage of men report having no close friends today?
